DataElement.preferredName: Patient Interstitial Disease Lung Personal Medical History Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator that asks if a patient has known interstitial lung disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Interstitial Disease Lung Personal Medical History
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to the personal medical history (an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced) of interstitial lung (the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place) disease (a disease occurring chiefly in the connective-tissue framework of an organ).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Interstitial Disease Lung Personal Medical History
Property.preferredDefinition: A disease occurring chiefly in the connective-tissue framework of an organ:One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has but two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border. SYN pulmo.:an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: A disease occurring chiefly in the connective-tissue framework of an organ.

One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have known h
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have known history or any evidence of active , non-infectious pneumonitis

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF_Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have known history of (non-infectious) pneumonitis that required steroids or current pneumonitis

ReferenceDocuments.name: Baseline Disease Description Form
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have interstitial lung disease that is symptomatic or may interfere with the detection or management of suspected drug-related pulmonary toxicity?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a known history of, or any evidence of active, non-infectious pneumonitis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF_Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have known history of (non-infectious) pneumonitis that required steroids or has current pneumonitis requiring steroids and/or immunosuppressive therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of (non-infectious) pneumonitis that required steroids, or current pneumonitis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have lung disease: pneumonitis, interstitial lung disease, idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, cystic fibrosis, Aspergillosis, active tuberculosis, or history of opportunistic infections (pneumocystis pneumonia or cytomegalovirus pneumonia)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of non-infectious pneumonitis/ILD that required steroids, or current non-infectious pneumonitis/ILD?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF TEXT 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have significant lung disease: dyspnea at rest grade 2 or greater (resulting from extensive tumor involvement or other causes), pneumonitis grade 2 or greater, interstitial lung disease grade 2 or greater, idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, cystic fibrosis, Aspergillosis, active tuberculosis, or history of opportunistic infections (pneumocystis pneumonia or cytomegalovirus pneumonia)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have lung disease: grade 2 or greater pneumonitis, grade 2 or greater interstitial lung disease, idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, cystic fibrosis, Aspergillosis, active tuberculosis, or history of opportunistic infections (pneumocystis pneumonia or cytomegalovirus pneumonia) within the past 6 months?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of and/or confirmed pneumonitis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of confirmed pneumonitis?

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.21 AQT added per ticket request CADSR0001812. ak 2022.11.15 AQT added for ticket request CADSR0001687. ak
